title: Skilled — Sponsored visa (subclass 886)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== ​This visa is closed to new applications. Skilled — Sponsored visa (subclass 886) Page Content ​The Skilled – Sponsored visa (subclass 886) closed to new applications on 1 January 2013. You must be in Australia when this visa is granted. Visa applicants Details This information is for people who have already applied for Skilled – Sponsored visa (subclass 886). You can no longer apply for this visa. Your application will be assessed against the requirements detailed below. After you have applied Details After you have lodged your application and documents, we will acknowledge that we have received your information. We will also assign you a case officer who will consider your application and can ask for an interview, ask for more information and make a decision. Wait for a decision Details Your application could take longer if you need character or health checks (including chest x-rays), if you need to provide more information, or if your application is incomplete. If you apply for this visa in Australia, you would be able to get a Bridging visa that allows you to stay in the country lawfully while your application is processed. If you are given a Bridging visa A , you can apply for Bridging visa B to travel outside Australia while you wait for a decision. Health and character requirements Details We will contact you when you need to provide health or character documents. Debts to the Australian Government Details You must have no outstanding debts to the Australian Government or have arranged to repay any outstanding debts to the Australian Government before this visa can be granted. Provide more information Details You can provide more information to us, at any time until a decision is made on the application. If you want to correct information you provided, use: Form 1023 - Notification of incorrect answer(s) (168KB PDF) We could also ask you for more information. You will have to respond by a set date. After that date, we can make a decision about your application using the information that we have. If another person gives us information that could result in you being refused a visa, we will usually give you the opportunity to comment on the information. You might also be interviewed. If you are asked to attend an interview in person, bring your passport or other identification and any requested documents to the interview. Withdrawing your application Details You can withdraw the application at any time before we make a decision about it. To do this, send us a letter or email to ask for the withdrawal. Your request must include your full name and date of birth. You should also include your file reference number, client ID, or a Transaction Reference Number. ​​​All applicants 18 years of age or older, wishing to withdraw, must sign the request for withdrawal.​​​​​​ Tell us if things change Details Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include: changes to your phone number, email, address or passport changes to your relationship status the birth of a child. See how to tell us if your situation changes Visa decision Details If the visa is granted, we will let you know: when you can use the visa the visa grant number any conditions attached to the visa.​ If the visa is not granted, we will let you know: why the visa was refused your review rights (if any). Where applicable, your sponsor can apply for the decision to be reviewed the time limit for lodging an appeal. Contact information Details ​If information needs to be updated, contact the Adelaide General Skilled Migration (GSM) processing centre .​​ Visa holders Details This information is for people who have already been granted a Skilled Sponsored visa (subclass 886). It explains your rights and obligations.​ You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check your visa details and entitlements. What this visa lets you do Details This is a permanent residence visa. It lets you and any member of your family unit who has also been granted this visa: stay in Australia indefinitely work and study in Australia enrol in Medicare Australia's scheme for health-related care and expenses apply for Australian citizenship (if you are eligible) sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residence travel to and from Australia for five years from the date the visa is granted (after that time, you will need a resident return visa or another visa to return to Australia). Your obligations Details You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. If you are nominated by a state or territory government agency, states and territories might also specify requirements that include: living in the nominating state or territory for a specified minimum time telling the state or territory your address, both before and after you arrive in Australia completing surveys and providing other post-arrival information they ask for. Sponsors Details This information is for a person who has applied to sponsor a relative for a Skilled Sponsored visa (subclass 886). This visa has now closed to new applications. ​ You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check your visa details and entitlements. How long the sponsorship lasts Details Your sponsorship lasts for two years after your relative’s visa is granted. Sponsor obligations Details As a sponsor you must sign a sponsorship undertaking and agree to help the applicant for two years after their visa is granted. This includes: accommodation and financial assistance as required to help meet their living needs other sup​port, such as children, to help them attend English language classes, if needed information and advice (including information about employment in Australia) to help them settle in Australia.
main_content:
===== main placeholder ==========================================

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

# Skilled — Sponsored visa (subclass 886)

Skilled — Sponsored visa (subclass 886)
Page Content

​The Skilled – Sponsored visa (subclass 886) closed to new applications on 1 January 2013.

​The Skilled – Sponsored visa (subclass 886) closed to new applications on 1 January 2013.

You must be in Australia when this visa is granted.

You must be in Australia when this visa is granted.

## Visa applicants

Visa applicants
Details

This information is for people who have already applied for Skilled – Sponsored visa (subclass 886).

This information is for people who have already applied for Skilled – Sponsored visa (subclass 886).

You can no longer apply for this visa.

You can no longer apply for this visa.

Your application will be assessed against the requirements detailed below.

Your application will be assessed against the requirements detailed below.

### After you have applied

After you have applied
Details

After you have lodged your application and documents, we will acknowledge that we have received your information.

After you have lodged your application and documents, we will acknowledge that we have received your information.

We will also assign you a case officer who will consider your application and can ask for an interview, ask for more information and make a decision.

We will also assign you a case officer who will consider your application and can ask for an interview, ask for more information and make a decision.

#### Wait for a decision

Wait for a decision
Details

Your application could take longer if you need character or health checks (including chest x-rays), if you need to provide more information, or if your application is incomplete.

Your application could take longer if you need character or health checks (including chest x-rays), if you need to provide more information, or if your application is incomplete.

If you apply for this visa in Australia, you would be able to get a Bridging visa that allows you to stay in the country lawfully while your application is processed. If you are given aBridging visa A, you can apply forBridging visa Bto travel outside Australia while you wait for a decision.

If you apply for this visa in Australia, you would be able to get a Bridging visa that allows you to stay in the country lawfully while your application is processed. If you are given a
Bridging visa A
, you can apply for
Bridging visa B
to travel outside Australia while you wait for a decision.

#### Health and character requirements

Health and character requirements
Details

We will contact you when you need to provide health or character documents.

We will contact you when you need to provide health or character documents.

#### Debts to the Australian Government

Debts to the Australian Government
Details

You must have no outstanding debts to the Australian Government or have arranged to repay any outstanding debts to the Australian Government before this visa can be granted.

You must have no outstanding debts to the Australian Government or have arranged to repay any outstanding debts to the Australian Government before this visa can be granted.

#### Provide more information

Provide more information
Details

You can provide more information to us, at any time until a decision is made on the application. If you want to correct information you provided, use:

You can provide more information to us, at any time until a decision is made on the application. If you want to correct information you provided, use:
- Form 1023 - Notification of incorrect answer(s) (168KB PDF)
Form 1023 - Notification of incorrect answer(s) (168KB PDF)

We could also ask you for more information. You will have to respond by a set date. After that date, we can make a decision about your application using the information that we have.

We could also ask you for more information. You will have to respond by a set date. After that date, we can make a decision about your application using the information that we have.

If another person gives us information that could result in you being refused a visa, we will usually give you the opportunity to comment on the information.

If another person gives us information that could result in you being refused a visa, we will usually give you the opportunity to comment on the information.

You might also be interviewed. If you are asked to attend an interview in person, bring your passport or other identification and any requested documents to the interview.

You might also be interviewed. If you are asked to attend an interview in person, bring your passport or other identification and any requested documents to the interview.

#### Withdrawing your application

Withdrawing your application
Details

You can withdraw the application at any time before we make a decision about it. To do this, send us a letter or email to ask for the withdrawal. Your request must include your full name and date of birth. You should also include your file reference number, client ID, or a Transaction Reference Number.

You can withdraw the application at any time before we make a decision about it. To do this, send us a letter or email to ask for the withdrawal. Your request must include your full name and date of birth. You should also include your file reference number, client ID, or a Transaction Reference Number.

​​​All applicants 18 years of age or older, wishing to withdraw, must sign the request for withdrawal.​​​​​​

​​​All applicants 18 years of age or older, wishing to withdraw, must sign the request for withdrawal.​​​​​​

#### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change
Details

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:
- changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
- changes to your relationship status
changes to your relationship status
- the birth of a child.
the birth of a child.

See how totell us if your situation changes.

See how to
tell us if your situation changes
.

### Visa decision

Visa decision
Details

If the visa is granted, we will let you know:

If the visa is granted, we will let you know:
- when you can use the visa
when you can use the visa
- the visa grant number
the visa grant number
- any conditions attached to the visa.​
any conditions attached to the visa.​

If the visa is not granted, we will let you know:

If the visa is not granted, we will let you know:
- why the visa was refused
why the visa was refused
- your review rights (if any). Where applicable, your sponsor can apply for the decision to be reviewed
your review rights (if any). Where applicable, your sponsor can apply for the decision to be reviewed
- the time limit for lodging an appeal.
the time limit for lodging an appeal.

### Contact information

Contact information
Details

​If information needs to be updated, contact theAdelaide General Skilled Migration (GSM) processing centre.​​

​If information needs to be updated, contact the
Adelaide General Skilled Migration (GSM) processing centre
.​​

## Visa holders

Visa holders
Details

This information is for people who have already been granted a Skilled Sponsored visa (subclass 886). It explains your rights and obligations.​

This information is for people who have already been granted a Skilled Sponsored visa (subclass 886). It explains your rights and obligations.​

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

### What this visa lets you do

What this visa lets you do
Details

This is a permanent residence visa. It lets you and any member of your family unit who has also been granted this visa:

This is a permanent residence visa. It lets you and any member of your family unit who has also been granted this visa:
- stay in Australia indefinitely
stay in Australia indefinitely
- work and study in Australia
work and study in Australia
- enrol inMedicareAustralia's scheme for health-related care and expenses
enrol in
Medicare
Australia's scheme for health-related care and expenses
- apply for Australian citizenship (if you are eligible)
apply for Australian citizenship (if you are eligible)
- sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residence
sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residence
- travel to and from Australia for five years from the date the visa is granted (after that time, you will need a resident return visa or another visa to return to Australia).
travel to and from Australia for five years from the date the visa is granted (after that time, you will need a resident return visa or another visa to return to Australia).

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

If you are nominated by a state or territory government agency, states and territories might also specify requirements that include:

If you are nominated by a state or territory government agency, states and territories might also specify requirements that include:
- living in the nominating state or territory for a specified minimum time
living in the nominating state or territory for a specified minimum time
- telling the state or territory your address, both before and after you arrive in Australia
telling the state or territory your address, both before and after you arrive in Australia
- completing surveys and providing other post-arrival information they ask for.
completing surveys and providing other post-arrival information they ask for.

## Sponsors

Sponsors
Details

This information is for a person who has applied to sponsor a relative for a Skilled Sponsored visa (subclass 886).

This information is for a person who has applied to sponsor a relative for a Skilled Sponsored visa (subclass 886).

This visa has now closed to new applications. ​

This visa has now closed to new applications. ​

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

### How long the sponsorship lasts

How long the sponsorship lasts
Details

Your sponsorship lasts for two years after your relative’s visa is granted.

Your sponsorship lasts for two years after your relative’s visa is granted.

### Sponsor obligations

Sponsor obligations
Details

As a sponsor you must sign a sponsorship undertaking and agree to help the applicant for two years after their visa is granted.

As a sponsor you must sign a sponsorship undertaking and agree to help the applicant for two years after their visa is granted.

This includes:

This includes:
- accommodation and financial assistance as required to help meet their living needs
accommodation and financial assistance as required to help meet their living needs
- other sup​port, such as children, to help them attend English language classes, if needed
other sup​port, such as children, to help them attend English language classes, if needed
- information and advice (including information about employment in Australia) to help them settle in Australia.
information and advice (including information about employment in Australia) to help them settle in Australia.
